fields.headline: Corrections and clarifications
fields.bodyText: • An article said that “181 NHS staff have died of Covid-19 in England”, attributing this figure to the charity Full Fact. That figure covers only the period up to 19 May; more up-to-date figures are not yet publicly available (‘Whenever you needed help, Josiane was there’, 18 August, page 4, G2). • A print headline (Pandemic ‘could strip British theatre of vital BAME talent’, 18 July, page 11) was not a direct quote from the actor Prasanna Puwanarajah, who has asked us to make clear that he does not use the term “BAME”. • Other recently amended articles include: UK firm’s solar power breakthrough could make world’s most efficient panels by 2021 Honey better treatment for coughs and colds than antibiotics, study claims Israel to suspend its contentious plan to annex parts of the West Bank Parents and teachers have lost faith in Gavin Williamson, government told ‘Walls of death’: surge in illegal drift nets threatens endangered species
